editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: WILLIAM DURAND, VINCENT OF BEAUVAIS &c.; S. XIV ex.

msItem.note: fol. i blank. To the verso is pasted a fragment of paper with the remains of a table of contents, s. xvi1.

msItem.author: WILLIAM DURAND
msItem.title: Rationale Diuinorum Officiorum
msItem.incipit: Quecumque in ecclesiasticis officiis rebus ac ornamentis consistunt
Prius est ut de ecclesia et eius partibus uideamus
msItem.explicit: pro peccatis meis deuotas oraciones effundant.

msItem.author: Vincent of Beauvais
msItem.title: De Eruditione Puerorum Nobilium
msItem.incipit: Serenissime ac reuerentissime domine sue Francorum Dei gracia regine Margarite
Nuper si bene recolitis
De puerorum nobilium erudicione
Filii tibi sunt erudi illos et curua [sic] illos a puericia
msItem.explicit: cum in nobis incipiet uirginitas honorari amen. Explicit liber ...

msItem.author: Vincent of Beauvais
msItem.title: Epistola ad Ludouicum
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus de morte amici consolatoria.
msItem.incipit: Dilecto Deo et hominibus illustrissimo domini in Christo sibi carissimo diuina fauente clemencia Francorum principi Ludouico
Regie magestati nostre scribendi fiduciam
In primis igitur aduertere debet illa que maxime personam nostram decet regalis prudencia
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit epistola de morte amici consolatoria.
msItem.note: Pr. Rostock 1477, Basel 1481, chs. 1–3 only ed. P. von Moos, ‘Die Trostschrift des Vinzenz von Beauvais für Ludwig IX’, Mittellateinisches Jahrbuch 6 (1967), 173–218 (text at 178–98); Kaeppeli 4004.

msItem.author: Vincent of Beauvais
msItem.title: De Morali Principis Institutione
msItem.incipit: Carissimis ac religiosissimis in Christo uiris et illustrissimis dominis omni honore ac reuerencia dignis principibus Ludouico regis Francie ac Theobaldo eiusdem fauente clemencia regi Nauarre et comiti Campanie
Olim dum in monasterio regalis montis
Sicut dicit apostolus ad Romanos vii. Multi unum corpus sumus in Christo

msItem.author: Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: De Praecepto et Dispensatione extracts
msItem.rubric: Tractatus Bernardi de precepto et dispensacione
msItem.incipit: (edn. p. 254 line 15) Fidei uestre non meo fidens ingenio abissum ingredior
(line 10) Bonus quidem obediencie gradus est si iuxta magistri nostri sentenciam pro metu Gehenne
msItem.explicit: (p. 293 line 4) absens perfectio [sc. pro profecto] est.
msItem.note: SBO 3. 253–94. A series of short passages selected from within two longer sections.

msItem.author: Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: Epistola ad Robertum
msItem.incipit: Quoniam huc usque frustratum

msItem.author: PETER OF BLOIS
msItem.title: De Periculis Prelatorum (Epist. 102)
msItem.incipit: Reuerendo patri et domini H. Dei gratia Radingis abbati
Quociens recolo uerba collacionis illius quam inter nos nuper habuimus
Tue conquestionis seriem pater fidelis sicut estimo recordacione collegi
msItem.explicit: et epistola transiuit in librum. Explicit

msItem.author: PETER OF BLOIS
msItem.title: Compendium super Iob
msItem.incipit: Henrici Dei gracia illustrissimo regi Anglorum
Gracias ago gracie largitori
Vir erat in terra Hus ...; Tria hic ponuntur s. simplex rectus et timens Deum
msItem.explicit: gloria que non transit quam nobis et uobis prestare dignetur altissimus altissimi filius I. C. qui ...
msItem.note: PL 207. 795–826; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6431; J. Gildea, ‘Extant manuscripts of Compendium in Iob by Peter of Blois’, Scriptorium 30 (1976), 285–7; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 418.

msItem.author: Isidore
msItem.title: De Ortu et Obitu Sanctorum Patrum
msItem.incipit: Quorumdam sanctorum nobilissimorumque uirorum ortus uel gesta cum genalogiis suis
msItem.explicit: de significacionibus quorundam uirorum dictorum liber.
msItem.note: Ed. C. Chaparro Gomez (Paris, 1985); CPL 1191; Diaz 103.

msItem.author: Isidore
msItem.title: In Libros Veteris et Novi Testamenti Prooemia
msItem.incipit: De librorum noui ac ueteris testamenti plenitudine

msItem.author: HUGH OF ST CHER
msItem.title: Speculum Ecclesiae
msItem.incipit: Dicit apostolus ad Ephesios vi. Induite uos armaturam Dei ...; Hec armatura est uestis sacerdotalis significatiua
msItem.explicit: Et ideo dicitur in principio et eciam fine misse.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit ordo misse qui dicitur Speculum sacerdotale.
msItem.note: At the head of fol. 420 are notes on art. 1 in a Continental cursive hand which annotates throughout; 420v blank.

supportDesc.collation: a singleton at each end, 1–338, 3410, 356, 36–408, 416, 42–98, 506, 51–38; catchwords; quire-signatures of the usual late medieval form. At the head of fol. 420v is written ‘ultimus quaternus’.

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled with crayon in 2 cols; written in c. 48 lines.

handDesc.handNote: An exceptionally elegant upright anglicana formata.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red and blue flourished initials; blue initials flourished in red; red paraphs, running heads, underlining and highlighting; highlighting also in yellow. Rubrics were supplied only spasmodically; there are no coloured initials from fol. 275 on.

binding.p: Late medieval; bevelled oak boards, slightly projecting at the foredge, now bare and the spine covered with pigskin, s. xix; sewn on eight bands. Two straps from recesses in the front board to clasps at the back, all gone; formerly chained from the front board, at the foredge near the head and foot. Only the first of these (in brass) has left a mark on fol. i. Also formerly chained from near the foot of the rear board. The outermost leaves were formerly pastedowns.

history.provenance: Made in England. It is not known when it reached the College prior to s. xvii.
On fol. iv is a sheet of paper with ‘D. 5, 9’ (canc.) and a table of contents, s. xvii. Above is ‘O. 1. 4. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced by ‘L. 2. 4 (CX)’ in red. Below is the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
